headline: Best Chicken Salad
description: This versatile chicken salad recipe is easy to make and perfect for using leftover chicken. Toasted almonds and crisp celery add flavor and crunch.

video.description: Everyone needs a good, basic chicken salad recipe in their collection of fool-proof dishes. This video shows you how to make chicken salad with six simple ingredients in just 10 minutes from start to finish.
video.name: Basic Chicken Salad Recipe

name: Best Chicken Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Place almonds in a frying pan. Toast over medium-high heat, shaking frequently. Watch carefully, as they burn easily.
Mix together mayonnaise, lemon juice, and pepper in a medium bowl.
Toss with chicken, toasted almonds, and celery.

review.reviewBody: I had grilled chicken breasts left from last night's dinner; and I wanted something very simple, quick, and easy. This was it. I have a policy when trying a new recipe not to tamper with the original, so I followed the ingredients and instructions exxactly. Very happy with resulst.
I love this chicken salad. It's a great twist on the traditional chicken salad with the toasted Almonds!!!!!
This is basically what my mom always did (me too), and is really, really good! I toasted some chopped walnuts as I didn't have almonds. Perfect!
great
I made this with left over Costco rotisserie chicken and added 1/4 to 1/2 tsp of Penzey's Justice seasoning. It was absolutely delicious! Better than Trader Joe's I bought a couple weeks ago.
I made half batch but added some cut up green seedless grapes. Very good salad.
Wonderful! Sour cream and Miracle Whip, ½ and ½ is a great idea!
Great recipe! I also added smoked paprika, parsley and celery salt for my spice levels and it’s fantastic!
Basically OK. I didn't toast the slivered almonds. A little bland. Needs more seasoning to wake it up a bit.
Had to make a couple changes cause of ingredients on hand and picky peeps. I didn't add the almonds, added chopped onions, garlic powder, onion powder and a dash of curry powder. So yummy!!

I love chicken salad , esp, in hot weather ! excellent as a Croissant Sandwich with plenty of lettuce , OR on an Onion roll... Great variation : CURRY POWDER , MINT , and Plumped RAISINS or CRANBERRIES
This was delicious, but I have to admit, I didn't want almonds in my chicken salad, so I omitted those, but this was delicious!

Just finished making this for lunches this week and it is DELICIOUS! I used shredded chicken that I had in the freezer after buying lots of chicken breast on sale and cooking/prepping it for future use. Not sure why doing that just occurred to me, but it was really easy to do and it’s healthy, as well as a huge time savings! The toasted almonds really make this recipe. I haven’t added the lemon juice yet, maybe tomorrow depending on how it tastes then. It is really good with just Mayo, celery, black pepper, onion and garlic powder, as well as tarragon as suggested by some other reviews. I didn’t measure-did it by taste & desired texture. Highly recommend!
It was quick and yummy. I didn't use almonds and added avocado and cheese.
I made the recipe as instructed. Loved the toasted almonds! Next time I want to try adding some green grapes. And there will definitely be a next time! Thanks for the recipe!

This was pretty good. I added 1/2 salt and that was too much. My mom used to add other things. Sometimes she added sliced grapes, at other times onion, eggs, and pickle relish. There may have been mustard in it too. Her chicken salad was really nice. I doubt I could reproduce it. Like everyone in the South, she used Duke's mayonnaise. It does make a difference.
Delicious... I added a few pecans, dried cranberries, and a dash of onion powder
This is a great recipe. So I changed everything.
Quick and easy as promised. I little bland, I might add grapes next time. Also, cut down on the Mayo.
This was really good and super simple. I toasted the almonds, I just prefer nuts toasted.
This is a great chicken salad to work from. I add halved grapes, or dried cranberries, and a little onion and salt and pepper as needed
Made it, deleted almonds and used smoked chicken breast.
Loved! Added a bit of spicy mustard to taste. (I serve on side if uncertain of guests tastebuds). Thanks for sharing!

I added a teaspoon of dill and it really elevated the flavor. I didn't have cooked chicken available so I sautéed chicken in olive oil. I seasoned it with salt, pepper, and italian seasoning. It would even taste better tomorrow morning after it chills and soaks in the mayo-goodness. 

To complete the dish, I served the chicken salad on homemade English muffin sliced bread, tomatoes, and lettuce.
I didn't have lemon juice so I subbed with lime juice. Good and tangy.
Good basic recipe. I took a taste bite and could tell it was missing something so I added a very small amount of dijon mustard. Also I didn’t blanch my almonds but they still tasted great.

Classic chicken salad plus the slivered almonds, tasty. 
I used some yogurt along with mayo and ranch dressing, with a pinch of six pepper blend.
*8/30: A very good basic recipe. I added some onion and garlic powder per other suggestions. I'd probably add some more "extras" next time, but a solid basic recipe.
This isagreat chicken recipe but instead of the lemon juice I put frozen grapes in.
Delicious

I really liked this simple but tasty chicken salad. The lemon juice gives it the right kick, although I think it needed a little salt. Next time I will add some grapes, think it would be a nice addition!
A very good base from which to start exploring different flavor avenues, based on what you might have already in the kitchen.
I used Costco Roasted Chicken so I loved how quick and easy it was to make this for a trip to the beach. Loved the basic, no frills of it as well.
I've never liked chicken salad but needed to do something with leftover rotisserie chicken. I minced everything but the almonds. It's very good. I put in a lot of lemon and pepper. Excellent.
Fast and easy and very tasty. It was a big hit with everyone.l
This was my first time making it and I must say that the response that I received was well gratifying! I will definitely make this again! Thank you Jackie M.
it's a bit too much celery for my liking so in the future ill make it with less but other than that good
I left out celery, used walnuts, added sweet pickle relish,added minced onion.

I've been using this basic recipe for awhile. I needed a substitute for the mayonnaise to trim some of the calories. I cook the chicken in the crockpot, shred it and put it in the refrigerator. I chop a bunch of celery and red onion ahead and then put it together each day for lunch. It's a quick tasty lunch filled with protein and less than 350 calories!

I have always used toasted almonds and I love the crunch of the celery pieces. For a bit of added flavor, I washed and chopped a few of the celery leaves, and a couple of fresh basil leaves, too This is the first time that I had heard of adding lemon juice; it really tied the flavors together!
Absolutely delicious. I did not use almonds because I didn't have any. It doesn't need it. I also used baked chicken thighs diced to give some extra flavor.
I added 1/2 Granny Smith apple, 1/2 t. salt and 1 t. seasoning salt; I used 2 c. mayo and 1-1/2 T. lemon juice for the dressing, since I added the apple.
It was delicious! I substituted chopped walnuts for almonds because that was what I had on hand. I also added some chopped red onion and used course ground pepper. Thanks for the basic recipe!
I added about a tablespoon of horseradish, dill, capers.

I have been looking for a chicken salad recipe for a very long time, and many of them are a little abundant with ingredients. This was the recipe I decided to make. I think it is absolutely delicious. I only had whole almonds, so I crunched them up with a tenderizer hammer and sautéed them in butter. I put a little bit of green onion sliced in there as well, it is delicious.

Thanks for great base recipe! I’ve never been able to find a recipe that works so well with the add-ons my family likes. I subbed the almonds with crushed walnuts, added 1 cup sliced red grapes and used a large can of precooked chicken breast in water that I had in my pantry. Very yummy and easy to make- I only made “one serving” and it was easily enough for 3-4 people to eat. Serve in multigrain pits pockets and with fresh fruit on the side for a balanced, healthy meal!
i don’t toast the almonds, but i do slice smokehouse ones!
Added little Dijon mustard and pinch of garlic salt
I made this without almonds because I didn’t have any on hand. I added onion and garlic powder and it came out great. Will be my go to for something quick and tasty.
Great recipe! Added a dash of cayenne pepper to spice it up a bit!

Did it pretty much the recipe way, but didn't have as many almonds as it called for. Also substituted half the black pepper for a garlic-pepper seasoning as well. We loved it! I upped the recipe to 4 servings and probably should have doubled that for 4 of us!!! Delicious!
Mixes up quickly. My husband and I loved it......great taste with the lemon juice added. I will make this often in the summer and add a few cut up green grapes!!

I always use this recipe as a starting point for left over rotisserie chicken so none of it goes to waste. I’m sure it would be equally as good with any other chicken. I omit the almonds because hubby just doesn’t like them. Omitting them greatly reduces the time it takes to make this dish. I also add some chopped green grapes. Every single bit of it gets eaten in my house every single time! Thanks for sharing!
Such a delicious chicken salad! Made it 2 ways - as is and added grapes. Perfect
It came out perfect. Added a little more meat due to leftover’s.

so easy and good! i have never made chicken salad before and was skeptical that this would be good with so few ingredients....but it was delish! i made it as written except the nuts and it was perfect!!!

The basic recipe is very good!!! I will make it again and play around. I did not have lemon juice. I added a little yellow mustard and that helped kick up the bright flavor. It's great and will even be better with the lemon! Thank you!!
very good. added chopped onions.
I love this recipe.
Seriously yummy and easy. Didn’t change a thing.
This made a nice simple meal that used up some leftover chicken. It needed some salt and celery seed IMHO, but otherwise it was tasty comfort food.

This a good recipe to use on that inexpensive chicken breast deals you find in the store. I just boil up the breasts and put them into a food processor. The family loves it as a snack or a before dinner appetizer. I like to add a bit of hot spice to give a kick.
This was quick and easy. I added walnuts and relish. I used a rotisserie chicken from the grocer's, cut it up fine and added onions.
Super just the way it is, although apples and grapes would probably taste great with it too.
Yes I chose not to put almonds. Yes I'll make it again. Very good
IT WAS A HIT!! EVERYONE LOVED IT!!!
My favorite chicken salad recipe. Made as is except substituted sour cream for 1/2 of mayonnaise. Can also use Greek yogurt for 1/2 mayonnaise. Have also added a little chopped onion at times.
Very simple, but very delicious. It works very well in pita bread.

This is an excellent recipe on its own or a base for adding some extra ingredients of your own taste. The toasted almonds and lemon juice are a must. Since discovering this recipe I keep a bag of slivered almonds in the cupboard. And I'll add red onion or any onion I have on hand and some seasoning of my own taste. Living alone I buy a rotisserie chicken from the supermarket have it for dinner and make chicken salad with the leftovers. Excellent recipe thank you very much.
Really good basic chicken salad. My only change was folding in some halved red grapes and this was delicious on a croissant.
Easy and good!
This is an excellent recipe. I could never make a tasty chicken salad myself. Thank you! I added red grapes and relish for extra flavor.

Basic chicken salad -- great as is or use your imagination to gussy it up. I like to add chopped apples or grapes cut in half (green or red or a combo). The toasted almonds add a great taste and the perfect amount of crunch. Thank you for sharing your recipe!
I would say this is a good recipe. I did follow recipe in a sense, I left out almonds because I’m it sure how almonds go well with chicken in my opinion. I did also add maybe half a diced onion.
Made it, less the almonds due to nut allergies, turned out great.

Simple and easy to make on a hot summer evening. I added a diced mango and a few slices of cooked plantain that I had left from the night before...I think you could add any ripe fruit in your fridge or even from a can!
Terrific basic chicken salad recipe. I substituted the almonds with pecans and added sliced grapes. It’s great to have on hand for lunch…husband even liked it!

Excellent basic chicken salad. I added toasted walnuts, sliced grapes, minced onion, Dijon mustard, garlic powder, black pepper, seasoned salt, and combined FF Greek yogurt w/light mayo. Now it's the BEST chicken salad! Hubby raved.
Good recipe, but I omitted nuts because I don't like nuts in salads. I did follow a reviewers suggestion and added onion powder and garlic powder for a little added flavor.
Very easy to make. Nice simple recipie.
I found it a bit watery and need to figure out how to correct that. We both liked it but will try a few changes: add a touch of dill, less mayo, more almonds and more celery, less grapes.
I used a rotisserie chicken and doubled the recipe. It's awesome as is, and a nice addition to my kids school lunches.

I thought this was a really good recipe. I pretty much followed it except I didn't add the lemon juice and I added a dash of rosemary. We like to eat ours with Hawaiian sweet slider buns and it was delicious!! I am definitely making it again during the hot summer months.
My entire family truly enjoyed eating this dish and everyone rated it a "5." I will definitely make this dish again and again.
I love using my instant pot to cook frozen chicken breasts. I had some in the fridge that I had cooked and made this chicken salad. Basic but very good.
Made this recipe several times. Delicious every time but it was the best when I toasted the almonds in a pan for a few minutes. I like to bake my chicken with lemon pepper seasoning too.

It does say it is basic so I made several changes, I added garlic power and onion power like a previous poster suggested. I also don't like mayo much so I cut that to 1/4c and used cream cheese and sour cream for the other 1/4c, it still came out dry so I added more mayo and sour cream probably equaling another 1/4 cup. I also used rotisserie chicken which may have been why it needed more mayo.,and toasted pecans instead of almonds because that was what I had on hand. Served it to some unexpected (but not uninvited) guests, when you say "stop by any time" you better be ready, I sliced up hot dog buns and made sliders out of them and it was a huge hit.
Husband loved it!

This recipe is a really good base. I ended up adding basil as well because the dressing was a little bland. I also did not add almonds but used a granny Smith apple and green onion in addition to the chicken and celery. this would also be very good with dries cranberries or craizins or other dried fruit.
Added greek yougurt instead of mayo! OMG TASTE GOOD
Calories Is Incorrect. Correct number is: 549
Delicious! I made it with leftover smoked chicken!

I used 1/4 cup sour cream and 1/4 cup mayo and substituted 
1tsp lemon zest. worked out great and will def. make it again.
It’s simple and easy to make. It tastes wonderful
Easy with lots of flavor.

This is great!!!! Thank you so much for sharing. I’m a guy who hates the kitchen. Seriously. And because of my night shift life, I leave for work as my wife comes home. This is the perfect thing to bring to work. Two servings with healthy snacks is a perfect day of food. The first time I made it my 10 year old tasted it and stole it from me. So now when I make it I have to make extra. Thanks again.
I used smoked cornish hen and added 1/4 c. minced onion. Perfect!
This was the perfect basic recipe. My family absolutely loved it. I did add some onion and garlic powder as some of the other comments suggested and it was perfect!
I found this very easy to make and the taste was great..
